scenarioDescription:
The HD 175541 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 175541 is a star with 1.39 times the mass of the Sun, and 4.19 times its radius. It is located 422.71 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.9 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 175541 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 175541 system


HD 175541 b

HD 175541 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2007-08, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.97 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 175541 b is 190.164 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 175541 b is 14.100 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 175541 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 175541, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 175541 - System With 1 Exoplanet
